channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Country music star Naomi Judd died by suicide, her daughter Ashley Judd said in a television interview, sharing details of her mother’s death in an effort to spread awareness of mental illness https://t.co/cO3ioaIfAn

Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky is Jewish. Why did the Russian foreign minister compare him to Hitler? The answer lies in the Putin regime’s distorted view of World War II and Russian history. https://t.co/YivebyKyQj
The Senate has voted to confirm Philip Jefferson, an economist and administrator at Davidson College of North Carolina, to the Federal Reserve https://t.co/QPmF8wpPQb
The crypto-trading firm Coinbase is warning that its customers could be viewed as general unsecured creditors during bankruptcy proceedings https://t.co/FPVY02hXgo
Kentucky Sen. Rand Paul has blocked quick passage of a bill to provide Ukraine nearly $40 billion more in aid https://t.co/ZhVN2uF7aY

Evidence of burial sites at 53 boarding schools for Native American children was found by an investigation by the U.S. Interior Department, according to a government report. The Interior Department said that it anticipated the number to rise. https://t.co/lpUPHQs3N5

Two senior executives at Twitter are leaving the company after being promoted to their positions in December. The departures come after the platform agreed to be acquired by Elon Musk. https://t.co/vSz8zFXIAE

Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky is Jewish. Why did the Russian foreign minister compare him to Hitler? The answer lies in the Putin regime’s distorted view of World War II and Russian history. https://t.co/tpp7AwidQb
An image of the supermassive black hole at the center of our galaxy has been captured for the first time https://t.co/LL6Um75jYt
Victims of the Surfside, Fla., condo collapse reached a $997 million settlement with insurers and other defendants over the disaster that killed 98 people last year https://t.co/ss3CCGexca

Video: Dozens of Ukrainian civilians were killed on one four-mile stretch of road outside Kyiv during March. A WSJ analysis reveals how Russian forces positioned themselves around the road to fire on and kidnap fleeing civilians. https://t.co/i09EpBSvXV
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/t1qVeb1qqM https://t.co/q8EdM8ZJAw
Miami locals say they're fed up with relocating New Yorkers driving up apartment rent https://t.co/e4azYsVruR
National security police arrested Hong Kong’s outspoken retired Cardinal Joseph Zen as part of a probe into a relief fund for people involved in prodemocracy protests https://t.co/XTlyPV37mE
National security police arrested Hong Kong’s outspoken retired Cardinal Joseph Zen as part of a probe into a relief fund for people involved in prodemocracy protests https://t.co/uQhqIj8rYY
North Korea imposed a lockdown in all its major cities after reporting its first local case of Covid-19, more than two years after the pandemic began https://t.co/qIedSuwfRD
The SEC is investigating Elon Musk’s late disclosure of his Twitter stake that let him buy more stock without alerting other shareholders, people familiar with the matter say https://t.co/pUeZcjqZnn
New York plans to direct $35 million to abortion providers to fund security upgrades and the cost of services for out-of-state patients, Gov. Kathy Hochul said https://t.co/rL7Vha3Px1

Drug-overdose deaths in 2021 topped 100,000 for the first time in a calendar year, federal data showed, a record high fueled by the spread of illicit forms of fentanyl throughout the country https://t.co/HqjOJWmZ3v
The SEC is investigating Elon Musk’s late disclosure of his Twitter stake that let him buy more stock without alerting other shareholders, people familiar with the matter say https://t.co/dpR6jDO6tm

Breaking: Senate Democrats failed to advance an abortion-rights bill, in a vote aimed to draw a contrast with Republicans ahead of a potential Supreme Court decision overturning Roe v. Wade looming just months before the midterm elections https://t.co/MyhcUGCY8H
Breaking: Victims of the Surfside, Fla., condo collapse reached a $997 million settlement with insurers and other defendants over the disaster that killed 98 last year https://t.co/pBikmgWNkd
Miami locals say they're fed up with relocating New Yorkers driving up apartment rent https://t.co/0rYC4wlJIk

From @WSJopinion: Americans have learned the hard way over the last two years that no amount of federal transfer payments can make up for the decline in real wages caused by inflation https://t.co/mmS39ZvNTt
An extra Mercury retrograde this year has concerned astrology fans postponing flights, marriages and home purchases https://t.co/ayL8p2IPGm

The Biden administration has asked congressional leaders to approve the sale of advanced weapons and other equipment for Turkey’s fleet of F-16 jet fighters, setting up a showdown with lawmakers https://t.co/a9exbDPPUO
U.S. inflation eased slightly in April to an 8.3% annual rate, dropping for the first time in eight months as energy prices moderated https://t.co/e7n1ttyr1w
Shireen Abu Akleh, a veteran reporter for the Al Jazeera news network, was shot and killed during an Israeli military raid into the West Bank city of Jenin https://t.co/ksE22EvGtv
Elon Musk says he would reverse Twitter’s ban on Donald Trump https://t.co/8j92dKeY7n
An organized crime prosecutor from Paraguay who was on his honeymoon in Colombia was assassinated Tuesday by gunmen who arrived at the private beach on jet skis https://t.co/sCfskLboU0
The Senate has voted to confirm Lisa Cook to the Federal Reserve, making her the first Black woman to sit on the central bank’s board https://t.co/yfRzSbF7pQ

Volkswagen is set to resurrect the Scout off-road vehicle brand as part of its bid to expand in the U.S., the world’s most profitable automotive market, as war and Covid-19 cloud its prospects in Europe, China https://t.co/tLeDNwBtdm
Russia will likely be targeted by yet more U.S. sanctions and export controls in response to its invasion of Ukraine, a senior U.S. official said https://t.co/VcpXtOxUSg
Apple’s iPod helped revolutionize the music industry when it was introduced more than two decades ago. Now, music fans will soon bid adieu to the portable player. https://t.co/UAojD2WjGt
From @WSJopinion: NATO should admit Finland and Sweden ASAP, writes @JohnRDeni. It would enhance the alliance’s security and send a powerful message to Russia. https://t.co/VmdVYV8c8O

Spain’s Carlos Alcaraz has yet to win a major tennis tournament. But after the 19-year-old phenom buzzed through Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Alexander Zverev to win the Madrid Open, the tennis world is stirred, writes sports columnist @jasongay. https://t.co/YilO39Jslw?
Breaking: Elon Musk said he would reverse Twitter’s ban on Donald Trump https://t.co/t0xSYveHcg
Digital banking platform Greenwood, created for Black and Latino customers, is acquiring a private professional membership club called The Gathering Spot https://t.co/q7QyWIWbqz
Miami locals complain that relocating New Yorkers are driving up apartment rents https://t.co/MNXQrteYaU
Attorney General Letitia James and state lawmakers say New York should pay for abortion access for low-income residents and out-of-state women https://t.co/5VNTY98eQy

South Korea’s new president said he would keep the door open for dialogue with North Korea and provide support for its fragile economy if Pyongyang stops developing nuclear weapons https://t.co/vRZWSZdeBr

Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa has resigned after months of mass protests against his government’s handling of an economic crisis that has led to double-digit inflation, rolling blackouts and acute shortages in fuel and medicines https://t.co/wb3iX58TJi
An upstart financial firm backed by Peter Thiel and Bill Ackman has a message for American corporations: Focus on making money, not taking stands. https://t.co/8vZNiwsIKA
Residents of recently Russian-occupied villages surrounding Kyiv are returning, removing debris from their rubble-strewn homes, planting vegetables and planning for the future https://t.co/iSXShej2H8

Elon Musk has cultivated close ties with Beijing to build Tesla’s business in China. Now that he is buying Twitter, WSJ looks at how China has used the social-media platform to promote its views, and why that’s raising concerns https://t.co/UmqtY7rJDz
Elon Musk said his plans for Twitter are aligned with new European Union rules aimed at compelling social media companies to do more to police illegal content https://t.co/L8Di0X5gug
An Andy Warhol portrait of Marilyn Monroe has sold for $195 million at Christie's, setting a record for an American artwork at auction https://t.co/0YUxoawBWz
Protesters in Poland drenched Moscow’s ambassador to Warsaw in red paint Monday after swarming a local cemetery for Soviet soldiers who died in World War II https://t.co/QAsjtdRfN8

The Senate has passed a bill expanding police protections for Supreme Court justices to include their immediate family members, in the wake of protests following a leaked draft ruling indicating the court could overturn Roe v. Wade https://t.co/VHHCsX38CQ

The risk of electricity shortages is rising throughout the U.S. And electric-grid operators are warning of rolling blackouts during heat waves or other peak periods as soon as this year. https://t.co/7v6zUiYlt1
